title: Security Issues in Wireless Sensor Networks (WSN)
narration: Welcome to this presentation on security issues in wireless sensor networks. We will explore the vulnerabilities and threats that these networks face and discuss potential solutions to enhance their security. Understanding these challenges is crucial for deploying robust and reliable WSNs.

title: Introduction to Wireless Sensor Networks
content:
Consist of small, resource-constrained sensor nodes.
Collect and transmit data wirelessly.
Deployed in open and unprotected environments.
Data integrity, confidentiality, and availability are key concerns.
image_desc: Wireless sensor network architecture. Type: diagram
narration: Wireless sensor networks are composed of numerous small sensor nodes that communicate wirelessly. These networks are often deployed in environments where they are easily accessible making them vulnerable to various security threats. Ensuring data integrity confidentiality and availability is paramount for these networks to function effectively.

title: Major Security Issues in WSN
content:
Node Capture Attack
Eavesdropping (Passive Attack)
Denial-of-Service (DoS) Attacks
Sybil Attack
Blackhole Attack
Wormhole Attack
Replay Attack
Energy Depletion Attack (Sleep Deprivation Attack)
image_desc: Security threats in WSN. Type: infographic
narration: We will now delve into the major security issues that plague wireless sensor networks. These include node capture attacks eavesdropping denialofservice attacks and several other sophisticated threats. Each of these attacks can compromise the network in different ways requiring specific countermeasures.

title: Node Capture Attack
content:
Attack: Physical capture of a sensor node.
Impact: Network disruption, unauthorized access, data leakage.
Solution: Tamper-resistant hardware, key revocation mechanisms.
image_desc: Node capture attack scenario. Type: illustration
narration: A node capture attack involves an attacker physically seizing a sensor node. Once captured the attacker can extract sensitive information like cryptographic keys and routing data. To mitigate this tamperresistant hardware and key revocation mechanisms are essential.

title: Eavesdropping (Passive Attack)
content:
Attack: Listening to communication between nodes.
Impact: Loss of confidentiality, exposure of sensitive data.
Solution: Encryption techniques (AES, ECC), secure key management.
image_desc: Eavesdropping on wireless communication. Type: illustration
narration: Eavesdropping is a passive attack where an attacker intercepts communication between nodes. This can lead to a loss of confidentiality and exposure of sensitive data. Encryption techniques like AES and ECC along with secure key management are crucial for preventing eavesdropping.

title: Denial-of-Service (DoS) Attacks
content:
Attack: Overloads the network with unnecessary traffic.
Impact: Network failure, communication breakdown.
Solution: Rate-limiting, intrusion detection systems (IDS), robust MAC protocols.
image_desc: Denial of service attack on a network. Type: diagram
narration: Denialofservice attacks flood the network with excessive traffic exhausting the nodes' energy and causing network failure. Solutions include ratelimiting intrusion detection systems and robust MAC protocols to manage and filter traffic effectively.

title: Sybil Attack
content:
Attack: A single malicious node claims multiple identities.
Impact: Disrupts routing, voting-based protocols, and data aggregation.
Solution: Identity verification, node authentication (public key cryptography).
narration: In a Sybil attack a single malicious node assumes multiple identities disrupting routing voting protocols and data aggregation. Identity verification and node authentication using public key cryptography are effective countermeasures.

title: Blackhole Attack
content:
Attack: A compromised node drops all received packets.
Impact: Disrupts network communication, leading to data loss.
Solution: Multi-path routing, trust-based authentication.
image_desc: Blackhole attack in network routing. Type: illustration
narration: A blackhole attack involves a compromised node that drops all received packets disrupting network communication and leading to data loss. Multipath routing and trustbased authentication can help mitigate this attack.

title: Wormhole Attack
content:
Attack: Tunnels messages between two remote locations.
Impact: Interferes with routing protocols, misleading nodes about network topology.
Solution: Geographical routing, time-stamp verification.
narration: A wormhole attack tunnels messages between distant locations interfering with routing protocols and misleading nodes about the network topology. Geographical routing and timestamp verification can help detect and prevent wormhole attacks.

title: Replay Attack
content:
Attack: Replays previously captured packets.
Impact: Misinformation and repeated execution of outdated commands.
Solution: Timestamp-based authentication, sequence numbers.
narration: In a replay attack an attacker replays previously captured packets to mislead the network causing misinformation and repeated execution of outdated commands. Timestampbased authentication and sequence numbers can effectively counter this threat.

title: Energy Depletion Attack (Sleep Deprivation Attack)
content:
Attack: Forces nodes to remain active continuously.
Impact: Reduces network lifespan, causing premature node failure.
Solution: Power-aware protocols, duty cycling techniques.
image_desc: Energy depletion attack on sensor nodes. Type: illustration
narration: An energy depletion attack also known as a sleep deprivation attack forces nodes to remain active continuously draining their battery power and reducing the network's lifespan. Poweraware protocols and duty cycling techniques are essential for conserving energy and preventing this attack.

title: Security Solutions for WSN
image_desc: Security solutions for WSN. Type: infographic
narration: Several security solutions can be implemented to protect WSNs. These include encryption authentication intrusion detection systems secure routing protocols and robust key management. These measures enhance data protection ensure reliable communication increase network lifespan and promote trustworthy data aggregation.

title: Conclusion
content: WSNs face numerous security threats due to their resource constraints and wireless nature. Implementing encryption, authentication, and intrusion detection mechanisms is crucial for ensuring data security and network reliability.
image_desc: Secure wireless sensor network. Type: illustration
narration: Wireless sensor networks face significant security threats due to their resource constraints and wireless nature. Implementing robust security mechanisms such as encryption authentication and intrusion detection is crucial for ensuring data security and network reliability. By addressing these challenges we can build more secure and dependable WSNs.
